paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various TTR variants associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, including demographic and clinical data of affected individuals.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Subject #5 has a TTR variant V30M, age at onset 23.
Subject #6 has a TTR variant V30M, age at onset 23.
Subject #7 has a TTR variant V30M, age at onset 69.
Subject #8 has a TTR variant V30M, age at onset 75.
Subject #16 has a TTR variant V30M, age at onset 70.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V30M variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to amyloid fibril deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study included patients with various TTR variants, but only V30M was detailed in the individual records.
key_quotes: Hereditary transthyretin (ATTRv) amyloidosis is a rare, adult-onset, progressive, multisystemic condition caused by TTR pathogenic variants.
The clinical course is progressive and disabling and leads to death within 4–15 years from onset if left untreated.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline demographic and clinical characteristics of the patients with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (n=16)

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants were extracted successfully.
